p: In addition, pathological viruses are intracellular and not always accessible to antibodies. For this reason, neutralizing antibody vaccines have not been effective against a number of complex viruses, including HIV, HCV, CMV, Zika, RSV, Dengue and SARS/MERS. For the same reason, convalescent serum prophylaxis and treatment may not be able to confer sterilizing immunity or memory. These sophisticated viruses may require an effective cellular immune response for sterilizing immunity [ 4– 8]. Without sterilizing cellular immunity, there can be viral recurrence as has been reported with COVID-19 [ 9].
